hypothesis_content.title: Options Expiry Pin Amplification Post-Major News
hypothesis_content.statement: When major crypto news (exchange hack, regulatory announcement, major ETF flow >$500M) occurs within 24 hours of monthly options expiry ($1B+ notional), and BTC is trading within ±3% of max pain price, the post-news move will be amplified by 1.8-2.2x relative to similar news events outside expiry windows.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Options dealers are heavily delta-hedged near expiry. Unexpected news forces rapid re-hedging that amplifies price moves as dealers buy/sell spot to maintain neutral exposure, creating reflexive feedback loops.
entry_conditions: Major crypto catalyst occurs (defined by >50% spike in crypto news sentiment score)
Within 24 hours of monthly options expiry (third Friday)
BTC price within ±3% of options max pain at time of news

exit_conditions.take_profit: Move reaches 2.0x the average 4-hour move of similar news events (historical benchmark)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price returns to pre-news level within 2 hours

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Less than 55% of qualifying events show amplification factor >1.5x relative to control group (similar news outside expiry windows).
